name: Tomatillo Chipotle Salsa
description: A rich Tomatillo Chipotle Salsa that's bursting with flavor. No one will believe you when you show them the tiny ingredient list. So good!

recipeInstructions.text: Husk and rinse the tomatillos, cutting out the stems.
recipeInstructions.name: Husk and rinse the tomatillos, cutting out the stems.

recipeInstructions.text: Roast the tomatillos in the oven at 400F for 10-20 minutes or until they start to turn army green in color and wrinkle up.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast the tomatillos in the oven at 400F for 10-20 minutes or until they start to turn army green in color and wrinkle up.

recipeInstructions.text: De-stem and de-seed two chipotles in adobo.
recipeInstructions.name: De-stem and de-seed two chipotles in adobo.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the roasted tomatillos, 2 peeled garlic cloves, and a single chipotle to a blender and pulse blend.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the roasted tomatillos, 2 peeled garlic cloves, and a single chipotle to a blender and pulse blend.

recipeInstructions.text: Take a taste for heat level. If you want more heat add more chipotle.
recipeInstructions.name: Take a taste for heat level. If you want more heat add more chipotle.

recipeInstructions.text: If you want a thinner salsa you can add 2-3 Tablespoons of water or a sliver of onion.
recipeInstructions.name: If you want a thinner salsa you can add 2-3 Tablespoons of water or a sliver of onion.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
